intro: Reutera tragioides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-green inflorescences. The plant is often found in coastal and forested areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for weaving and crafting, highlighting its cultural and practical significance. Reutera tragioides plays an important role in the ecological and botanical diversity of New Zealand's flora.
